JeongHun Park

Research intern focused on Multimodal Perception, Commonsense Reasoning, and Computer-Use Agent. Long-term goal: recursively self-improving agents equipped with personalized memory.

  • Location/Education: B.S. Computer Science & Engineering, Seoul National University (Mar 2020 – Feb 2026, expected)
  • Contact: top321902@snu.ac.kr
  • GitHub: @PJH6029
  • Resume: Download CV

Objective

Push the capabilities of large language models across pre-training, post-training, multimodal extensions, and interpretability, ultimately enabling self-improving and reliable agentic systems.

Experience

Research Intern · Human-Centered Computer System Lab, SNU (Apr 2024 – Dec 2025)

  • Advancing the Lumo project by developing natural-language agents that rely on robust API-based tool-calling.
  • Exploring limitations of existing agent patterns (e.g., ReAct) and proposing/new prototyping architectures for higher accuracy.
  • Shifted focus from prompt tweaks to system-level agent-pattern research for harder, multi-step tasks.

Software Engineering Intern · FADU (Jul 2024 – Aug 2024)

  • Built an internal Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot for navigating technical specifications.
  • Designed a scalable pipeline that integrates multiple LLM providers and vector databases for reliable document access.

Teaching Assistant · Seoul National University (Sep 2022 – Present)

  • Supported Computer Programming (2022 Fall, Prof. Lee), Logic Design (2024 Spring, Prof. Lee), Programming Practice (2024 Fall, Prof. Jeon), and Basic Computing (2024 Fall, Prof. Kim; 2025 Spring, Prof. Yamada).

Projects

ARC-AGI Task Solver using LoRA Fine-Tuning (2025 Spring)

  • Fine-tuned Qwen3-4B on ARC-AGI tasks using LoRA adapters and heavy data augmentation.
  • Built an inference stack combining few-shot prompting, test-time training, and majority voting for stable outputs.
  • Crafted a fine-grained loss to extract informative gradients from few-shot examples, accelerating convergence.

Minimal Deep Learning Framework (2024 Winter)

  • Implemented a PyTorch-like framework with define-by-run backprop and GPU acceleration via CuPy.
  • Built a dynamic computation graph and autograd engine from scratch for educational clarity.

Coursework & Academics

  • GPA 3.9/4.3 (≈4.1/4.5); Major GPA 4.07/4.3 (≈4.25/4.5).
  • Coursework highlights: Artificial Intelligence, Mathematical Foundations of Deep Neural Networks, Operating Systems.

Technologies

  • ML/AI: PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain, Google ADK
  • Interests: Multimodal Perception, Commonsense Reasoning, Computer-Use Agent
